Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= man; ◄ son of Amram (עַמְרָם) and Jochebed (יֹוכֶבֶד) younger brother of Miriam (מִרְיָם) and Aaron (אַהֲרֹן) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► leader of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) during exodus

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
literally: to cry out; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities let (other) humans know that they are to come, either by approaching them directly or sending a message
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity
= man; ◄ son of Uri (אוּרִי) tribe of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► craftsman working on tabernacle (מִשְׁכָּן)
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= man; ◄ son of Hur (חוּר) tribe of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► father of Bezalel (בְּצַלְאֵל)
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= man; ◄ tribe of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► father of Uri (אוּרִי) grandfather of Bezalel (בְּצַלְאֵל)
= group of clans (מִשְׁפָּחָה) united by a common leader

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
= causative action by which someone causes a certain location, container, or surface to be filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= state whereby someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
literally: knowledge; hence: = state in which humans have the experience, skill, and expertise to carry out a particular activity
= action by which humans exercise their mind (לֵב) with the purpose of creating an artifact
= procedure for the production of an artifact
literally: to do; hence; = action by which humans and engaged in a specific activity, usually in the service of someone else
= metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth, beauty, and prosperity
= silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins
= causative process by which someone makes incised marks on a surface of wood or stone with the help of a sharp and hard tool
= small object ◄ consisting of a variety of stone that is considered precious because of its beauty and scarcity; ► used as ornament or decoration; ≈ association with honor, majesty, and glory
literally: to fill; hence: = causative action by which a craftsman attaches a mounted stone on a certain surface
= causative process by which someone makes incised marks on a surface of wood or stone with the help of a sharp and hard tool
= a single piece of wood taken from a tree, cut and finished, and used for building and construction
literally: to do; hence; = action by which humans and engaged in a specific activity, usually in the service of someone else
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= man; ◄ son of Ahisamach (אֲחִיסָמָךְ) tribe of Dan (דָּן) ► craftsman working on tabernacle
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= man; ◄ tribe of Dan (דָּן) ► father of Oholiab (אָהֳלִיאָב)
= group of clans (מִשְׁפָּחָה) united by a common leader
= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fifth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and first son of Bilhah (בִּלְהָה) slave of Rachel (רָחֵל) ► founder of a tribe
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

literally: Tent of Meeting; hence: = construction, also referred to as the Tabernacle (מִשְׁכָּן) or the Tent of the Testimony, ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► as the sanctuary where YHWH chose to meet with his people, before Solomon's temple was built

literally: Tent of Meeting; hence: = construction, also referred to as the Tabernacle (מִשְׁכָּן) or the Tent of the Testimony, ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► as the sanctuary where YHWH chose to meet with his people, before Solomon's temple was built

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= wooden box, overlaid with gold and with a golden cover with cherubs, normally placed behind the veil in the tabernacle or temple, but also carried along during military campaigns; ► symbolizing the presence of YHWH among his people and used to store the two tablets with the law of God and other objects representing important events in the history of Israel

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

Node.gloss: cover, lid (of the ark of the covenant)
Node.definition: = a flat, rectangular object with two golden figures with wings on its top, made out of hammered gold, ► and used to cover the Covenant Box (אֲרֹון) which represented the presence of YHWH among his people; this is also the place where, once a year, on the Day of Atonement, blood from sacrificial animals was sprinkled; ≈ associated with atonement
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= human made object of any kind, usually specified by the context, ◄ of various makings ► and made for various purposes
= construction ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► used as a temporary residence by nomads, soldiers, shepherds, and even as a sanctuary

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

literally: something that has been spread out; hence: = a flat surface on which food has been spread out for eating ◄ usually made of wood but can be a piece of animal skin or leather ► used in private and public occasions, and frequently for sacred uses in the tabernacle and temple

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= stand ► designed to hold one or more lamps so that the lamps can light a large area
= state in which objects consist of pure ingredients from which all contaminants have been carefully removed; ≈ regarded as attractive and desirable

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= human made object of any kind, usually specified by the context, ◄ of various makings ► and made for various purposes

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= construction with a flat top, ◄ originally made out of stones that were not cut and shaped with tools, later also out of metal; ► used for burning sacrifices
= substance ◄ made from tree gum or bark ► to make a sweet smell; it is burned in a censer or on an open fire ≈ to provide a sweet aroma pleasing to God

Node.definition: = state in which humans have been ordained (מלא) and consecrated (קדשׁ) to function as a priest (כֹּהֵן)

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= high quality oil (שֶׁמֶן) ◄ extracted from the fruits of the olive tree during the first pressing; ► used as food, medicine, fuel, perfume (when mixed with spices), and other purposes; also used in various religious rituals; ≈ associated with joy, but also known for its softness, smoothness, and elusiveness
= oil that is used for anointing objects and people

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

Node.gloss: to cause to die|to kill|to put to death
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans, animals, or deities cause (other) humans or animals to stop living

literally: to cut off; hence: = causative action by someone humans are no longer considered members of their community and are to be banished
= a human being, as defined by the life principle that animates him/her
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine
= state in which a countable entity is six in number

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine

a more or less fixed phrase: the heavens and the earth, equivalent to a single lexical item: the totality of God's creation

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine

literally: to (be able to) breathe; = action by which humans cease or interrupt a strenuous activity ► in order to recover their strength and ability to function
= man; ◄ son of Amram (עַמְרָם) and Jochebed (יֹוכֶבֶד) younger brother of Miriam (מִרְיָם) and Aaron (אַהֲרֹן) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► leader of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) during exodus
= causative action by which deities, humans, or animals bring an activity to full completion

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= mountain and surrounding desert on the Sinai Peninsula in Egypt, also known as Mount Horeb (חֹורֵב) ► location where YHWH (יהוה) entered into a covenant (בְּרִית) with Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= state in which a countable entity is two in number
= small, flat tablet, ◄ made of stone, ► on which words were scratched with a stylus; ≈ associated with conditions that are permanent and are not likely to change
= small, flat tablet, ◄ made of stone, ► on which words were scratched with a stylus; ≈ associated with conditions that are permanent and are not likely to change
= hard, heavy, and strong substance, ◄ very commonly found in nature, ► which can be hewn into different shapes by a craftsman
= action by which humans or deities mark letters, words or other symbols on a surface, such as clay, stone, skin, or papyrus, usually with a pointed stylus or reed
= one of the five long and slender projections of the human hand; ► used for writing, pointing, grasping, and other activities; ≈ sometimes used metonymically to represent the entire body
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
